intro: Psidium mattogrossense, commonly known as the Brazilian guava or yellow guava, is a small evergreen tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, acidic flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and fruit production, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
